text: the ak-47s inventor dies news about
North Korea's purge and New York's ten
best restaurants good evening this is
the New York Times minute mikhail
kalashnikov the inventor of the ak-47
has died at age 94 his guns are an
emblem of conflict but Mr Kalashnikov
said he was untroubled by his
contribution to bloodshed there are 100
million ak-47s in use worldwide and news
from North Korea today new evidence
suggests the uncle of North Korean
leader Kim jong-un who had been executed
apparently had not plotted a coup
instead he fell victim to intrigue over
his lucrative business dealings with
China and the times is out with the list
of top 10 restaurants this year atop the
list sushi Nakazawa which received a
four-star Times review earlier this year
rounding out the top three carbone
serving Italian and bettany known for
its chicken you'll have to read the
article to find out who made the rest of
the list
